==What to Do==
Don't allow user input in format strings. (Re-)Write code to guarantee that user input is never used in format strings.
==Why==
An attacker who can control the contents of a format string may be able to execute arbitrary code.
==How==
Perform the following actions to ensure that user input is not used in format strings:
# **Identify code that uses formatted input-output functions.** The following is a list of formatted input-output functions: #* //NSLog// #* //stringWithFormat// #* //stringByAppendingFormat// #* //initWithFormat// #* //appendFormat// #* //alertWithMessageText// #* //informativeTextWithFormat// #* //format// #* //appendFormat// #* //predicateWithFormat// #* //sprintf// #* //_snprintf// #* //printf// #* //fprintf// #* //scanf// #* //fscanf// #* //sscanf// #* //swprintf// #* //wsprintfA// #* //wsprintfW// #* //vsprintf// #* //vswprintf// #* //_snwprintf// #* //_vsnprintf// #* //_vsnwprintf// #* //vprintf// #* //vwprintf// #* //vfprintf// #* //vwfprintf// #* //fwscanf// #* //wscanf// #* //swscanf// # **Avoid using formatted functions.** Consider replacing formatted input-output functions with other functions, which are not prone to format string vulnerabilities. # **(Re-)Write code to exclude user input from format strings.** Place user input in separate variables and pass it as variadic arguments to the formatted input-output functions, instead of allowing it in format strings.
